the.railsi.st

About

the.railsi.st is Patrick Crowley.

I'm a Rails developer and this blog is a record of my experiences using Ruby on Rails to build web apps.

I also run SD Ruby, a local Ruby group in San Diego known for its podcast.

Plugins

  • Javascripter - Organize your .js
  • Headliner - DRY up page titles
  • Styler - Stylesheets made easy

Podcasts

I've given several talks about Rails.

  • Paperclip
  • Haml & Sass
  • Headliner & Styler
  • Rails for Legacy apps
  • ActsNaked
  • ActsAsTaggable
  • Summer of Rails

Recent work

  • Chumby
  • Roxy
  • Graffletopia
  • SD Ruby
  • Summer of Rails

Consulting

I'm available for freelance.

New SD Ruby podcast episodes

In case you don't subscribe to the SD Ruby podcast, we just uploaded a huge batch of fresh episodes.

We've got talks on ActsAsSolr, Edge Rails, Seaside, ActiveRecord Backup & Mimetypefu, JRuby, AJAX CSS stars, Amazon SQS, Capistrano, and more.

There's also a 20 minute talk on Headliner and Styler that I gave back in May.

(Sydney RORO members can skip this one... this is the same talk I did in Australia.)
